ref: 7042 nāgakēsara m. ʻ the tree Mesua roxburghii ʼ, n. ʻ its flower ʼ Suśr. [Orig. trade name of the stamens of the nāga tree used as a scent, I. H. Burkhill Proc. of the Linnaean Soc. of London, Session 156 1943 -- 4 Pt. 2, 88. -- nāga -- 3, kḗsara -- ]
